etymology.description: 厦(廈) (xià, "mansion") and 门(門) (mén, "gate") together form a name for the city of Xiamen.
etymology.interpretation: 厦门(廈門) (Xiàmén, "Xiamen") originates from the area's historical significance as a gateway to the sea. "厦" indicates the grand structures or mansions often found in the city, while "门" signifies its strategic importance as a gate or entrance point.

examples.chinese: 我从北京坐飞机去厦门(我從北京坐飛機去廈門)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ cóng Běijīng zuò fēijī qù Xiàmén.
examples.english: I take a plane from Beijing to Xiamen.

examples.chinese: 厦门有美丽的海岸线(廈門有美麗的海岸線)，吸引了许多游客(吸引了許多遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàmén yǒu měilì de hǎi'ànxiàn, xīyǐnle xǔduō yóukè.
examples.english: Xiamen has a beautiful coastline, attracting many tourists.
